Data:
==Applies To==

* All Android applications.

==What to Do==

Obfuscate code with //ProGuard//.

==Why==

Obfuscate the application binary with //ProGuard// to make it more difficult to reverse engineer.

==How==

To obfuscate code with //ProGuard//:

# **Configure //ProGuard//.** Edit the //proguard.cfg// file to suit your application.
# **Enable //ProGuard//.** Change the //proguard.config// property in the //project.properties// file to point to the location of the //proguard.cfg// file.
# **Enable release mode.** //ProGuard// is executed automatically by the Android build system when it is used to build applications in release mode.
# **Build the application.** Build your application in release mode to obfuscate the binary with //ProGuard//.

==Code Integrity Guidelines==

* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000004ef2c8|Sign Android Application Updates]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000003c4a74|Sign Android Applications]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000038da94|Obfuscate Code with ProGuard]]

==Code Integrity Checklists==

* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000007571e5|Android Application Updates Are Signed]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000045de75|Android Applications Are Signed]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000008e33ab|Code Is Obfuscated with ProGuard]]

==Additional Resources==

* For more information about //ProGuard//, please see http://developer.android.com/tools/help/proguard.html
* For //ProGuard// documentation, please see http://proguard.sourceforge.net/manual/introduction.html
